support.faq1Q: How do I request a payout?
support.faq1A: Navigate to the Payouts section and click "Request Payout". Fill in the required details and submit.
support.faq2A: Our standard rules include 5% daily drawdown, 10% overall drawdown, and 4 minimum trading days.
support.faq3A: Payouts are processed within 24-48 hours after approval. Bank transfers may take additional 2-5 business days.
support.faq4Q: Can I trade during news events?
support.faq4A: Yes, news trading is allowed on all challenge types. There are no restrictions on trading during high-impact news.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Find answers to common questions about our challenges and platform.
faq.supportDescription: Our support team is here to help you 24/7.

whatIsPropCapitals.q: What is Prop Capitals and how does it work?
whatIsPropCapitals.a: Prop Capitals is a proprietary trading firm that funds traders with real capital. Here's how it works: 1) You purchase an evaluation challenge (starting from $90). 2) You trade on a demo account and prove you can hit the profit target while staying within the drawdown rules. 3) Once you pass, you receive a funded account with real capital. 4) You trade the funded account and keep up to 90% of the profits you generate. You never risk your own money beyond the initial challenge fee.

howToStartChallenge.q: How do I start a challenge step by step?
howToStartChallenge.a: Step 1: Go to the Challenges page and pick your evaluation type (1-Phase, 2-Phase, or Instant Funding). Step 2: Choose your account size ($10K to $200K). Step 3: Complete payment via credit card, crypto, or other supported methods. Step 4: You'll receive your trading credentials (server, login, password) via email within 5 minutes. Step 5: Log into your trading platform and start trading. Your challenge begins on the day of your first trade — there is no time pressure to start immediately.

tradingPlatforms.q: What trading platforms and instruments are available?
tradingPlatforms.a: Platforms: We support MetaTrader 4 (MT4), MetaTrader 5 (MT5), cTrader, and DXTrade. You choose your platform at checkout. Instruments available: All major, minor, and exotic forex pairs (e.g. EUR/USD, GBP/JPY, USD/ZAR). Indices: US30, NAS100, S&P500, DAX40, FTSE100, and more. Commodities: Gold (XAUUSD), Silver (XAGUSD), Oil (WTI, Brent). Crypto CFDs: BTC/USD, ETH/USD (availability varies by platform). Leverage ranges from 1:10 to 1:100 depending on the instrument and account type.

howToPass.q: How do I actually pass the challenge?
howToPass.a: To pass, you need to meet ALL of these conditions: 1) Hit the profit target — 8% for Phase 1, 5% for Phase 2 (2-Phase), or 10% for 1-Phase. 2) Do not exceed the 5% daily drawdown on any single day. 3) Do not exceed the 10% maximum overall drawdown from your peak balance. 4) Trade for a minimum of 4 separate trading days (a trading day = at least one trade open for 2+ minutes). There is no time limit, so focus on consistency over speed. Tip: Risk 1-2% per trade, trade during high-volume sessions (London/New York overlap), and avoid revenge trading after losses.

evaluationTypes.q: What's the difference between 1-Phase, 2-Phase, and Instant Funding?
evaluationTypes.a: 2-Phase (Most Popular): Two evaluation stages. Phase 1: hit 8% profit. Phase 2: hit 5% profit. Same drawdown rules in both phases. After passing both, you get funded. This is the most affordable option. 1-Phase: Single evaluation — hit 10% profit in one go. Faster path to funding but requires a slightly higher target. Instant Funding: Skip the evaluation entirely. You get a funded account immediately after purchase. Higher upfront cost, but you start earning profits from day one. All three types have the same drawdown rules (5% daily, 10% max) and the same funded account benefits.

drawdownExplained.q: How does the daily drawdown work exactly?
drawdownExplained.a: The daily drawdown limit is 5% of your account balance at the start of each trading day (server time midnight). Example: If your account starts the day at $50,000, your maximum loss for that day is $2,500. Your equity cannot drop below $47,500 at any point during the day — this includes open (floating) trades, not just closed trades. The daily drawdown resets every day at midnight server time. If you close the day with a profit (e.g. balance now $52,000), tomorrow's daily limit is recalculated from $52,000, giving you $2,600 of room. Important: The check is on equity, not just balance. If you have an open trade losing $3,000 even momentarily, that counts as a violation.

maxDrawdownExplained.q: How does the maximum overall drawdown work?
maxDrawdownExplained.a: The maximum drawdown is 10% from your highest achieved account balance (this is trailing). Example: You start with $50,000. Your absolute drawdown floor is $45,000. If your balance grows to $55,000, your new floor moves up to $49,500 ($55,000 - 10%). The floor never moves back down — it only goes up as you make profit. This means: the higher your profits go, the tighter your cushion becomes relative to the peak. Many traders take a payout before their balance gets too high to lock in profits and give themselves more breathing room.

profitTargets.q: What are the exact profit targets for each challenge type?
profitTargets.a: 2-Phase Challenge: Phase 1 = 8% profit target, Phase 2 = 5% profit target. Example on $50K: Phase 1 target is $4,000 profit, Phase 2 target is $2,500. 1-Phase Challenge: 10% profit target in a single phase. Example on $50K: Target is $5,000 profit. Instant Funding: No evaluation profit target — you're funded immediately. Profit is calculated from closed trades only (floating P&L doesn't count toward the target). You can exceed the target — there's no cap. The target is the minimum needed to pass.

tradingDays.q: What counts as a trading day and how many do I need?
tradingDays.a: A trading day is any calendar day (server time) where you have at least one position open for more than 2 minutes. You need a minimum of 4 trading days to pass each phase. This means: You cannot pass the challenge in under 4 days, even if you hit the profit target on day 1. The 4 days do not need to be consecutive. Opening and closing a trade within 2 minutes does not count. Holding a trade overnight that spans 2 calendar days counts as 2 trading days.

allowedStrategies.q: What trading strategies and styles are allowed?
allowedStrategies.a: Allowed: Scalping, day trading, swing trading, position trading. News trading (including high-impact NFP, FOMC, CPI). Weekend and overnight holding. Hedging (opening opposing positions on the same instrument). Expert Advisors (EAs) and automated trading bots. Any technical or fundamental strategy. Not Allowed: Latency arbitrage or tick scalping exploiting price feed delays. High-frequency trading (HFT) exploiting server infrastructure. Copy trading between your own multiple Prop Capitals accounts. Account management services (someone else trading your account). Grid/martingale strategies are allowed but risky — use at your own discretion.

leverage.a: Leverage varies by instrument: Forex Majors: up to 1:100. Forex Minors/Exotics: up to 1:50. Indices (US30, NAS100, etc.): up to 1:50. Gold (XAUUSD): up to 1:50. Oil & Commodities: up to 1:20. Crypto CFDs: up to 1:2. These are maximum values — you can use less. Tip: Using high leverage isn't required to pass. Many successful traders use effective leverage of 1:5 to 1:20 and focus on proper position sizing.

whatTriggersViolation.q: What exactly triggers a violation and disqualification?
whatTriggersViolation.a: Hard violations (instant disqualification): 1) Daily Drawdown Breach: Your equity drops more than 5% below the day's starting balance at any point, even for a second. 2) Max Drawdown Breach: Your equity drops more than 10% below your highest achieved balance at any point. Soft violations (account locked until next day): If your equity gets very close to the daily limit, the system may lock trading for the rest of the day to protect you. Important details: Violations are checked in real-time against your equity (balance + floating P&L). Gaps at market open can cause a violation if your floating loss jumps. The system does not give warnings — once the threshold is touched, it's instant. You can monitor your drawdown in real-time on your dashboard.

freeRetry.q: How does the free retry work?
freeRetry.a: If your account reaches 8% profit at any point during the challenge BEFORE failing, you qualify for a free retry. How it works: You fail your challenge (drawdown breach). The system checks if your account ever hit 8% profit during the challenge. If yes, you receive a free retry automatically — same account size, fresh start. If no, you can purchase a discounted reset instead. The free retry gives you a completely fresh account with all rules reset. Your previous trades and history do not carry over.

afterFailing.q: What are my options after failing a challenge?
afterFailing.a: You have three options: 1) Free Retry (if eligible): If you hit 8% profit before failing, you get a new account for free automatically. 2) Discounted Reset: Purchase a reset at a reduced price. You keep the same account size and plan, but get a fresh start. Reset prices are typically 20-30% less than the original challenge fee. 3) New Challenge: Start completely fresh — you can choose a different account size or evaluation type if you want. Tip: If you failed due to emotional trading or overleverage, take a break before restarting. Analyze your trades in the analytics dashboard to understand what went wrong.

commonMistakes.q: What are the most common reasons traders fail?
commonMistakes.a: Based on our data, the top reasons for failure are: 1) Overleveraging: Risking more than 2-3% per trade. One bad trade wipes out the daily drawdown. 2) Revenge Trading: Trying to recover losses immediately after a losing trade, often with bigger position sizes. 3) Ignoring the Daily Drawdown: Forgetting that the 5% daily limit includes floating (unrealized) losses on open trades. 4) Trading without a stop loss: A sudden market move can breach your drawdown before you can react. 5) Not checking the dashboard: Your real-time drawdown is displayed on your dashboard — check it before placing new trades. Tip: Aim for 1-2% risk per trade. If you lose 2-3% in a day, stop trading. Come back tomorrow with a fresh daily drawdown.

profitSplit.q: What is the profit split and how is it calculated?
profitSplit.a: The profit split determines how much of your trading profits you keep. Default split: 80% to you, 20% to Prop Capitals. With scaling: Up to 90% to you at higher levels. How it's calculated: If your funded account makes $10,000 profit and your split is 80%, you receive $8,000. The split applies to net profit only (after subtracting any losses). Example: You start the cycle with $50,000. After 14 days your balance is $54,000. Net profit = $4,000. Your payout at 80% split = $3,200.

payoutProcess.q: How do I request a payout step by step?
payoutProcess.a: Step 1: Log into your dashboard and go to the Payouts page. Step 2: Ensure you have been on your funded account for at least 14 days. Step 3: Click 'Request Payout' and enter the amount you want to withdraw (minimum $50). Step 4: Choose your payment method (crypto, bank wire, PayPal, or Wise). Step 5: Submit the request. Step 6: The payout is reviewed and processed within 24-48 business hours. After the payout, your funded account balance is adjusted and you continue trading. Your drawdown levels are recalculated from the new balance.

paymentMethods.q: What payment methods are available for payouts?
paymentMethods.a: Available payout methods: Cryptocurrency: BTC, ETH, USDT (TRC-20 or ERC-20) — fastest option, usually arrives within hours. Bank Wire Transfer: Available worldwide, takes 2-5 business days after processing. PayPal: Fast and convenient, arrives within 1-2 business days. Wise (TransferWise): Low-fee international transfers, arrives within 1-3 business days. All payout methods have zero fees from our side. Your bank or payment provider may charge their own receiving fees. You can change your payout method between withdrawals.

payoutFrequency.q: How often can I withdraw profits?
payoutFrequency.a: Payout schedule: Payouts are bi-weekly (every 14 days). Your first payout is available 14 days after receiving your funded account. After each payout, the 14-day cycle resets. There is no maximum on the number of payouts — you can withdraw every cycle indefinitely. Minimum withdrawal: $50 per payout. Maximum withdrawal: No cap — you can withdraw all your available profits. Tip: You don't have to withdraw everything. You can leave profits in the account to increase your trading capital and drawdown room.

howScalingWorks.q: How does the scaling plan work step by step?
howScalingWorks.a: The scaling plan increases your funded account size as you prove consistency. Requirements to scale: 1) Achieve at least 10% profit on your funded account. 2) Complete at least 2 payout cycles (minimum 28 days of funded trading). 3) Maintain good risk management (no near-violations). When you qualify: Your account size increases by 25%. Example: $50,000 → $62,500 → $78,125 → $97,656 → and so on. Maximum account size: $2,000,000. Your profit split also increases at each level, up to 90%. Scaling is automatic — once you meet the criteria, you'll be notified and your account is upgraded.

scalingExample.q: Can you show an example scaling path?
scalingExample.a: Starting with a $50,000 funded account: Level 1: $50,000 (80% profit split). Level 2: $62,500 (82% split) — after 10% profit + 2 payouts. Level 3: $78,125 (84% split). Level 4: $97,656 (86% split). Level 5: $122,070 (88% split). Level 6: $152,588 (90% split). And it continues up to $2,000,000. At $100K with 88% split, if you make 5% monthly profit ($5,000), your payout is $4,400/month. At $200K with 90% split at 5% monthly ($10,000), your payout is $9,000/month. Consistency is more important than big gains — steady 3-5% monthly profit will scale you faster than chasing 20% months.

scalingReset.q: What happens to my scaling progress if I violate a rule?
scalingReset.a: If you breach a drawdown rule on your funded account: Your current account is disabled. Scaling progress is NOT lost — your level is preserved. You receive a new funded account at the same scaling level. You keep your profit split percentage. You start with a fresh balance at your current scaled size. Example: You're at Level 3 ($78,125) and breach the daily drawdown. You get a new $78,125 account and continue from where you left off. However, if you repeatedly violate rules, your scaling progress may be reviewed.

multipleAccounts.q: Can I run multiple challenges or funded accounts at the same time?
multipleAccounts.a: Yes, you can have multiple accounts simultaneously. Rules for multiple accounts: You can run different account sizes and evaluation types. Each account has independent drawdown tracking. You CAN trade the same instruments across accounts. You CANNOT copy-trade between your own Prop Capitals accounts (running the exact same trades at the same time on multiple accounts). You CAN use the same general strategy with different execution. Example: You could run a $50K 2-Phase challenge for swing trading and a $25K Instant Funding for scalping at the same time.

inactivity.q: What happens if I stop trading for a while?
inactivity.a: Challenge accounts: There is no time limit, so inactivity does not cause a failure. However, you need 4 trading days minimum to pass, so extended breaks just delay completion. Funded accounts: If you have no trading activity for 30 consecutive days, your account may be flagged for review. We recommend placing at least one trade per month to keep your account active. Your drawdown levels are NOT affected by inactivity — they remain where they were when you last traded.

refund.a: Refunds are available within 14 days of purchase, provided: You have NOT placed any trades on the account. The account has not been used in any way. Once you place your first trade, the evaluation has officially started and refunds are no longer available. To request a refund: Contact support@prop-capitals.com with your order number. Refunds are processed within 5-7 business days to the original payment method.

contactSupport.q: How do I get help if I have a problem?
contactSupport.a: Support channels: Email: support@prop-capitals.com (response within 24 hours). Live Chat: Available 24/7 on the website (bottom-right corner). Dashboard Tickets: Submit a support ticket from your dashboard for account-specific issues. For urgent issues (account errors, payment problems): Use live chat for the fastest response. Include your account number and a screenshot of the issue. Common self-service options: Check your dashboard for real-time account status, drawdown levels, and trade history. Use the Analytics page to review your trading performance.

transparentRules.title: Transparent Rules

scaleTo2M.title: Scale to $2M

timeLimit.q: How do I pass the challenge?
timeLimit.a: Hit the profit target (8% Phase 1, 5% Phase 2 for 2-Phase; 10% for 1-Phase) while staying within the 5% daily drawdown and 10% max drawdown limits. You need a minimum of 4 trading days, but there is no maximum time limit. Tip: Risk 1-2% per trade and focus on consistency — you don't need to rush.

newsTrading.q: What can I trade and what strategies are allowed?
newsTrading.a: You can trade forex pairs (majors, minors, exotics), indices (US30, NAS100, DAX40), commodities (Gold, Silver, Oil), and crypto CFDs. All strategies are allowed: scalping, day trading, swing trading, news trading, EAs/bots, and weekend holding. The only restrictions are latency arbitrage and copy-trading between your own Prop Capitals accounts.

ifFail.q: What happens if I fail the challenge?
ifFail.a: You have three options: 1) Free retry if your account reached 8% profit before failing. 2) Discounted reset at 20-30% off the original price. 3) Start a new challenge with a different size or type. Check your dashboard analytics to review what went wrong before restarting.

payoutSpeed.q: How do payouts work once I'm funded?
payoutSpeed.a: Payouts are bi-weekly (every 14 days). Request a withdrawal from your dashboard (minimum $50, no maximum). Choose crypto, bank wire, PayPal, or Wise. Processed within 24-48 hours. You keep 80-90% of profits depending on your account level. Your profit split increases as you scale up.

drawdownExplanation.title: Understanding Drawdown
drawdownExplanation.subtitle: The most important rules to follow

dailyDrawdown.title: Daily Drawdown (5%)
dailyDrawdown.description: The maximum you can lose in a single day, calculated from the day's starting balance. Resets at midnight server time.
dailyDrawdown.exampleText: With a $50,000 balance, your daily drawdown limit is $2,500.

maximumDrawdown.title: Maximum Drawdown (10%)
maximumDrawdown.description: The maximum total drawdown from your highest achieved balance. This is a trailing drawdown that follows your highest equity.
maximumDrawdown.exampleText: If your highest balance was $55,000, your max drawdown level is $49,500.

cta.title: Ready to Start Trading?
cta.subtitle: Now that you understand the rules, choose your challenge and begin your funded trading journey.

acceptance.title: 1. Acceptance of Terms
acceptance.content: By accessing and using Prop Capitals's services, you agree to be bound by these Terms of Service. If you do not agree to these terms, please do not use our services.

description.title: 2. Description of Services
description.content: Prop Capitals provides proprietary trading evaluation programs ("Challenges") that allow traders to demonstrate their trading skills. Successful completion of a Challenge may result in access to a funded trading account.

eligibility.title: 3. Eligibility
eligibility.content: You must be at least 18 years old to use our services. By using Prop Capitals, you represent that you have the legal capacity to enter into this agreement.

accountRegistration.title: 4. Account Registration
accountRegistration.content: You agree to provide accurate, current, and complete information during registration. You are responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of your account credentials.

tradingRules.title: 5. Trading Rules
tradingRules.content: All traders must adhere to the trading rules specified for their Challenge type. Violation of these rules may result in account termination without refund.

prohibitedActivities.title: 6. Prohibited Activities
items: Exploiting platform vulnerabilities or bugs
Using third-party account management without disclosure
Engaging in arbitrage trading between different brokers
Copy trading from accounts at different prop firms
Any form of market manipulation

refundPolicy.title: 7. Refund Policy
refundPolicy.content: Refunds are available within 14 days of purchase if no trades have been placed. Once trading activity begins, no refunds will be issued.

payouts.title: 8. Payouts
payouts.content: Funded traders are eligible for bi-weekly profit withdrawals according to their profit split agreement. Prop Capitals reserves the right to verify all trading activity before processing payouts.

intellectualProperty.title: 9. Intellectual Property
intellectualProperty.content: All content, trademarks, and intellectual property on Prop Capitals's platform are owned by Prop Capitals and protected by applicable laws.

limitationOfLiability.title: 10. Limitation of Liability
limitationOfLiability.content: Prop Capitals shall not be liable for any indirect, incidental, or consequential damages arising from your use of our services.

modifications.title: 11. Modifications
modifications.content: Prop Capitals reserves the right to modify these terms at any time. Continued use of our services after modifications constitutes acceptance of the updated terms.

contact.title: 12. Contact
contact.content: For questions about these terms, please contact us at support@prop-capitals.com

informationWeCollect.title: 1. Information We Collect
informationWeCollect.intro: We collect information that you provide directly to us:
items: Personal identification information (name, email, phone number)
Payment information (processed securely through third-party providers)
Trading account data and activity
Communication records with our support team
KYC documentation (ID, proof of address)

howWeUse.title: 2. How We Use Your Information
items: To provide and maintain our services
To process transactions and send related information
To monitor trading activity and enforce our rules
To communicate with you about updates and promotions
To detect and prevent fraud

dataSecurity.title: 3. Data Security
dataSecurity.content: We implement industry-standard security measures to protect your personal information. This includes encryption, secure servers, and regular security audits.

dataSharing.title: 4. Data Sharing
dataSharing.intro: We may share your information with:
items: Trading platform providers (MT4, MT5, cTrader, DXTrade)
Payment processors for transaction handling
KYC verification services
Legal authorities when required by law

yourRights.title: 5. Your Rights
items: Access your personal data
Request correction of inaccurate data
Request deletion of your data (subject to legal requirements)
Opt-out of marketing communications
Request data portability

cookies.title: 6. Cookies
cookies.content: We use cookies and similar technologies to enhance your experience, analyze usage patterns, and personalize content. You can manage cookie preferences through your browser settings.

dataRetention.title: 7. Data Retention
dataRetention.content: We retain your personal information for as long as your account is active or as needed to provide services. We may retain certain information for legal compliance and dispute resolution.

internationalTransfers.title: 8. International Transfers
internationalTransfers.content: Your information may be transferred to and processed in countries other than your country of residence. We ensure appropriate safeguards are in place for such transfers.

childrensPrivacy.title: 9. Children's Privacy
childrensPrivacy.content: Our services are not intended for individuals under 18 years of age. We do not knowingly collect information from children.

contactUs.title: 10. Contact Us
contactUs.content: For privacy-related inquiries, please contact our Data Protection Officer at support@prop-capitals.com
